intro: Diospyros boinensis, commonly known as the Bornean persimmon, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ebenaceae family, which includes other well-known species like the ebony tree. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange to red, fleshy fruits. The fruits are typically edible, though some varieties may have a涩 (astringent) taste when unripe.
